intro: Alectra humbertii, commonly known as the Humbert's sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the rocky and sandy soils of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of tiny, white flowers. The plant typically thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and nutrient-poor conditions. Its compact growth habit and ornamental appearance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Alectra humbertii is also valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil in harsh environments.
